name: Ms. Sheila O'Hara
biography: O’Hara was born in Kobe, Japan where her parents were living at the time of her birth, but soon after, moved back to the United States. She began weaving as a child and later enrolled at California College of Arts & Crafts, in Oakland, CA, where she majored in textiles. As a child, her parents had collected many Japanese objects, and these, particularly kimonos, inspired O’Hara’s designs. She has exhibited all over the world and has taught in many different universities and colleges.
